title.narrative: NATIONAL SOCIAL PROTECTION RESPONSE

description.narrative: GoT coordinates a multi-sectoral social protection response to the needs of economically deprived and insecure groups, which contributes to Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: GoT coordinates a multi-sectoral social protection response to the needs of economically deprived and insecure groups

description.narrative: Significant progress has been made towards the establishment of a more integrated, inclusive and child sensitive policy and programmatic framework for social protection in Tanzania, which is responsive to the needs of the poor a | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/08/2016

title.narrative: Coverage of national social protection interventions to respond to the needs of economically deprived groups

baseline.value: Limited coverage of social protection interventions, mostly small-scale, sporadic and donor-funded

target.value: 2016:Increase in coverage of national programmes (PSSN, CHF) in terms of geographic scope and number of beneficiaries (PSSN target: operational in 40 districts)

actual.value: 2016:PSSN has met its target to reach Tanzanian extreme poor population, amounting to about 1.1 million households and accounting for around 15% of the total population. The programme currently covers all districts in Tanzania (both Mainland and Zanzibar).

title.narrative: Status of approval and implementation of the National Social Protection Framework and related regulations and programmes

baseline.value: NSPF pending adoption, Weak coordination across sectors, fragmented programmes

target.value: 2016:Policy and programme framework in place to guide and inform national SP response

actual.value: 2016:The NSPF has been finalized by an Inter-ministerial Task Force led by PMO and is now awaiting approval by the new Government. Nonetheless, the roadmap for the preparation of its implementation plan has been finalized by PMO. The implementation plan for the ZSPP has been finalized and its costing is

title.narrative: Costing of key social protection programmes carried out and related fiscal space options identified

target.value: 2016:Costing and fiscal space analyses completed and reflected into National Social Protection Framework and related programmes

actual.value: 2016:A Fiscal Space Analysis for Social Protection in Tanzania has been prepared, including costing of key social protection programmes, and utilized as a basis for the social protection financing strategy enclosed in the NSPF.
